title: Los Angeles wildfires: Why do fires happen in the middle of winter?
summary: Climate change is lengthening the fire season, which now starts earlier and ends later while expanding risk areas to higher latitudes and elevations. The number of disasters is also increasing, with fire becoming frequent, more intense, and longer-lasting.

title: Trump slams Democrats, blames Governor 'Newscum,' for deadly fires in Los Angeles
summary: California has long been a target of Donald Trump's ire, with the most populous US state long having voted for Democrats, even if Trump made some modest gains in the 2024 election.

title: Between China and the US, the trade war has already begun
summary: Not a week goes by without the world's two leading powers publicly locking horns, announcing trade restrictions against each other.

title: The rekindled spark of the Syrian revolution in Daraa
summary: The southern Syrian town was the cradle of the revolution in 2011, before being hit by the regime's repression. Some residents who have returned from exile are celebrating Bashar al-Assad's fall, hoping that the new government will deliver justice.

title: Kaja Kallas, EU High Representative: 'The US is still our great ally'
summary: Despite Donald Trump's sweeping declarations and his henchman Elon Musk's meddling in Europe, the European Union's new High Representative for Foreign Affairs refuses to get caught up in the controversy.

title: Zurich, European "capital of expats:" a blessing or curse?
summary: The Swiss metropolis is now Europe's top destination for high-income foreign professionals. While they fuel the local economy, they’re also pushing up rents and driving gentrification in traditionally working-class neighborhoods.

title: Divided Supreme Court denies Trump's bid to delay sentencing in hush-money case
summary: Judges in New York, where the case is being tried, determined that the 34 felony convictions for falsifying business records were connected to personal matters, not to Trump's actions as president. He is set to be sentenced on Friday.

title: Devastating wildfires continue to tear through Los Angeles
summary: Wind speeds should slow on Thursday, which officials hope will give firefighters a chance to contain the deadly blazes that have broken out across the Los Angeles area.

title: Musk doubles down on support for German far-right leader
summary: Musk, who used his influence and vast wealth to propel Trump to victory in the 2024 White House race, has been vocal in his support for the AfD ahead of snap elections in Germany on February 23.

title: French minister to Musk and Zuckerberg: 'Stop instrumentalizing freedom of speech'
summary: In an interview, French Junior Minister for Artificial Intelligence and Digital Technologies Clara Chappaz reacts to the accusations of 'censoring' leveled by the owner of X and the founder of Meta against EU laws.

title: Venezuela's Maduro tests opposition with brief detention of key leader
summary: Machado's press team said in a social media post that security forces "violently intercepted" her convoy as it was leaving eastern Caracas, on Thursday, January 9. The opposition leader has been released hours earlier.

title: Army chief Joseph Aoun elected as Lebanese president
summary: Aoun received 99 out of 128 votes in Parliament after failing to get the required majority in the first round earlier in the day.

title: Bikes to blame for Paris's slow buses
summary: Paris City Council and bus users agree that bus traffic in the capital has been neglected for too long in favor of cyclists. An agreement was recently signed to try and improve bus traffic.

title: 'Not a cent' of Libyan money spent on political campaigns, Sarkozy tells French court
summary: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy was defiant in court on Thursday as he denied charges of illegal campaign financing against him.

title: Former US president Jimmy Carter honored with state funeral
summary: All five living US presidents gathered in Washington for Carter's state funeral. President Joe Biden delivered a eulogy.

title: Spanish group buys Christian Lacroix
summary: The ready-to-wear brand, founded in France in 1987 was acquired by Sociedad Textil Lonia from American Falic.

title: Denmark outraged following Trump's statements on Greenland
summary: During a press conference, the president-elect of the United States did not rule out the use of force to seize the autonomous territory. His remarks have sparked strong reactions within the Scandinavian kingdom, a NATO member.

title: In 'The Room Next Door,' Pedro Almodovar captures the depths of friendship at death's doorstep
summary: Spanish filmmaker's first movie shot in the US captures the bond between two women, as one claims her final act.

title: French authorities promised to 'combat agribashing.' But attacks on intensive agriculture are scant
summary: Five years after being set up in certain parts of France, with much fanfare, the bodies monitoring this controversial 'ideological' concept have seen little or no activity, according to documents obtained by the ARIA association.
